keyword: how many calories in spaghetti with meat sauce
title: How Many Calories in Spaghetti with Meat Sauce?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in spaghetti with meat sauce per serving, including carbs, protein, fat, and nutrition breakdowns for easy meal planning.
h1: How Many Calories in Spaghetti with Meat Sauce?
assumptions: Standard 1-cup serving (~250 g total: cooked spaghetti, ground beef tomato sauce); homemade style with moderate oil, no extra cheese.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, portion size, meat type, sauce ingredients, and cooking method. Check labels or recipes for precision.

quick_answer.text: One serving of spaghetti with meat sauce contains about 350 kcal and 18 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use ground turkey instead of beef

faqs.q: How many calories in one serving of spaghetti with meat sauce?
faqs.a: Approximately 350 kcal for a standard 1-cup serving.

faqs.q: What's the protein content in spaghetti with meat sauce?
faqs.a: About 18 g protein per serving, mainly from the meat and pasta.

faqs.q: How many carbs are in spaghetti with meat sauce?
faqs.a: Around 42 g carbs per serving, mostly from the pasta.

faqs.q: Does spaghetti with meat sauce have a lot of sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, about 600 mg per serving due to sauce and seasonings; opt for low-sodium versions.

faqs.q: How to reduce calories in spaghetti with meat sauce?
faqs.a: Use leaner meat, more veggies, whole wheat pasta, or smaller portions to cut calories.
